result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel R Roark

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on January 12, 2023 at 11:00 am.

10:55 AM Defendant Daniel R Roark in court.  AttorneyKarl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. DA Kelz states this is a return on warrant. Court goes over the record and questions defendant on non-appearance. Defendant gives responses. DA Kelz moves to quash the warrant and reinstate the previous bond. So Ordered. The court also orders the forfeiture of the bond vacated. Court questions defendant on status of obtaining counsel. DA Kelz gives date of  01/12/2023 at 11:00 am for a Preliminary hearing.
Ordered forfeited 9/26/22 non appearance at status hearing

9:08 AM ADA calls case and states appearances. Defendant Daniel R Roark not in court.  Attorney Mark T. Fuhr in court for State of Wisconsin. Court goes over the record and the history of notices sent. Court states the Notice of Hearing has not been returned undeliverable and the courtroom is open. ADA Fuhr moves for a bench warrant in the amount of $2,500. So Ordered Plus warrant fee. ADA Fuhr also requests bond forfeiture proceedings begin. So Ordered.
Status hearing on September 26, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status hearing on September 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

10:25 AM Prosecuting attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel R Roark in court. Complaint acknowledged, reading waived. Notice of right to attorney given to DE. Bond already set and is to continue. Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived. Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
State's demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA evidence
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Order on Petition for Appointment of Attorney- DENIED
Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency

DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges. Defendant Daniel Roark appeared via video from the Price County Jail. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE next court date is 04/05/2022 at 10 am.  Jail gives DE a notice of right to attorney.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation. Bond ordered as requested.

Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless he/she has a valid Driver's License in their possession
Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety while operating a motor vehicle
Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): D.E. unless a written waiver is filed with the Clerk of Courts Office OR with the Price County Sheriff's Department outside of normal business hours.
Defendant is to contact a representative from the ISP program with 20 days of 03/01/22
